alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 8:16AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Spink and Brown Counties. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Ashton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, The water overtops the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued by Sunday afternoon.
